title: CIDR Boundary Alignment
description: Check if IP addresses, ranges, and CIDR blocks align to specific prefix boundaries

input.networkInputsTooltip: Enter IP addresses, CIDR blocks, or ranges to check alignment
input.inputsTooltip: Enter one per line: CIDR blocks, IP ranges, or individual IP addresses
input.inputHelp: Enter one per line: CIDR blocks (192.168.1.0/24), IP ranges (10.0.0.1-10.0.0.100), or single IPs (172.16.1.5)
input.targetPrefixTooltip: The prefix length boundary to check alignment against (e.g., 24 for /24 boundaries)
input.targetPrefixHelp: Prefix length to check alignment against (0-32 for IPv4, 0-128 for IPv6)

validation.mustBeValidNumber: Target prefix length must be a valid number
validation.outOfRange: Target prefix length must be between 0 and 128
validation.ipv4OutOfRange: Target prefix length cannot exceed 32 for IPv4 addresses
validation.ipv6OutOfRange: Target prefix length cannot exceed 128 for IPv6 addresses
validation.notPractical: Target prefix length of 0 is not practical for alignment checking

results.summaryTooltip: Overview of alignment results across all inputs
results.totalInputsTooltip: Total number of network inputs processed
results.alignedTooltip: Networks that align to the target prefix boundary
results.misalignedTooltip: Networks that do not align to the target prefix boundary
results.alignmentRateTooltip: Percentage of inputs that align to the target boundary
results.checksTooltip: Detailed results for each network input

check.alignedCIDRTooltip: The CIDR block that properly aligns to the target prefix boundary
check.reasonTooltip: Explanation of why this input aligns or doesn't align
check.suggestionsTooltip: Alternative CIDR configurations that would align to the target boundary
check.efficiencyTooltip: Address space utilization efficiency of this suggestion
